page.title: 01Countryside S Of Modbury
page.content: This is an area of farmland within the coastal hills of Devonshire's south hams. To the SE of the block is a small concentration of farms and cottages, and the whole is intersected by small lanes set within high, grass grown Devon stone hedges. There are very few trees. Traditional farming is milk and beef production from S Devon and Friesian Cattle, carried out on medium sized, family owned or tenanted units. Land use, however is undergoing rapid change, with the acquisition of larger acreages by fewer owners. Traditional pasture fields are being opened up for arable crops, mainly barley, but including wheat, potatoes, rape and turnips. This is inevitably changing the appearance of the countryside as hedges are removed, allowing easier use without its barns and dwellings,
